todos.title: Cone of Uncertainty
todos.body: The earlier you are in a project the more you are likely to miss your estimate.

todos.title: Week Sprints
todos.body: Week sprints are recommended because you are never a week away from knowing that there is a problem.

todos.title: Resources & Environment
todos.body: Understand the environment and resources you have to complete the work.

todos.title: Things that often blow up an estimate
todos.body: UI, missing requirements, extra time to standup scaffolding, implementing customer feedback from acceptance testing.

todos.title: Take into consideration team size
todos.body: The more developers assigned to a project, the more communication and the less effective each developer will be.

todos.title: How Critical Is Estimate
todos.body: The more critical and larger the project, the more time you should spend estimating.

todos.title: Spike
todos.body: Taking time to identify requirements analysis.

todos.title: Books
todos.body: Steve McConnell – Software Estimation Demystifying the Black Art.

todos.title: If You Don’t Know
todos.body: Say “I’ll get back to you.”

todos.title: Law of Large Numbers
todos.body: One large estimate could be off by a large number in either way.  Many small estimates tend to average out.

todos.title: Day isn’t a day
todos.body: Not all developers get 100% day due to other responsibilities, vacation, support, etc.

todos.title: Blind Bidding
todos.body: Multiple people each take a guess and reveal their estimate at the same time.

todos.title: Ramp Up
todos.body: Make sure to consider ramp up time.

todos.title: Documentation
todos.body: Make sure to consider handoff and documentation.

todos.title: Requirements
todos.body: Make sure all the requirements are clearly spelled out.

todos.title: Don’t Overestimate
todos.body: If you pad, pad in just one place.

todos.title: Testing
todos.body: Estimates should include testing time.

todos.title: Story Buckets
todos.body: Estimate in terms of half day, day, half week, week.  If something is greater than a week, split it up into smaller components.

todos.title: QA
todos.body: Did you factor in QA time.

todos.title: Indirect Costs
todos.body: Cost of time for project managers, architects.

todos.title: Direct Costs
todos.body: Cost of time for developers, testers.

todos.title: Ways to estimate
todos.body: By story, count of components, relative to other similar projects, blind bidding.

todos.title: Critical Thinking
todos.body: Ask questions surrounding Methodic Process Checklist.  What are we going to build, how, who, how fast.

todos.title: Things to help reduce estimate uncertainty
todos.body: Approving product definition, clear and concise requirements, user interface design complete, detailed design complete.
